title: Humour and the Conduct of Politics

The incongruity model differs from the superiority model, which dominated from the time of Plato to the eighteenth century. The superiority model suggested that humour emanates from a feeling of superiority over either someone else or a former state of ourselves. A third model for understanding how humour functions is the relief model, which suggests that laughter is the release of energy in the nervous system
